title: Allow to retrieve block hash and other fixes and improvements
Rename axfrz to afrz
body:
Bug using the indexer to parse transactions if the tx type was ever asset freeze. Simple fix
s/axfrz/afrz

title: Dryrun printer utility
Fix dryrun endpoint
body:
Had to move some models around to be able to reference `ApiSignedTransaction` (previously in the transactions package) from `DryrunRequest` (which makes sense to keeps in the models package).

Further, nothing was working, changed the request format to msg pack, fixed deserialization etc.

title: Remove app call parameter
body: Added by mistake - this builder is specific for `NoOp`.

title: Use hardcoded estimated tx size, improve naming
body: Fixes https://github.com/manuelmauro/algonaut/issues/146

title: Atomic Transaction Composer
body:
Ported from the latest official SDKs (Go v1.14.1 and Java 1.13.0 - had to alternate between both a bit). Ported all the related unit and integration/cucumber tests (ABI and C2C features). Did refactorings (also in https://github.com/manuelmauro/algonaut/pull/154) especially at high level, to make things more idiomatic for Rust, prevent type casting, split large functions etc. It can be improved more, but I'm already way over the time allocated for this.

Closes https://github.com/manuelmauro/algonaut/issues/150

title: Support ABI
body:
Ported from the current last versions of the official SDKs (Go v1.14.1 and the unit tests mostly from Java 1.13.0, since I had issues running the Go tests. Go is supposed to be reference SDK - from what I could see, the tests were ported to the Java SDK, and there were some additional ones which I ported too).

Closes https://github.com/manuelmauro/algonaut/issues/149

title: Rename AlgonautError in ServiceError
body:
These errors are specific to the algod/kmd/indexer REST client wrappers and not general to Algonaut.

`ServiceError` sounds extraneous, as we don't have anything called "service", but it's a kind of implied name for the algod/kmd/indexer wrappers, which are currently in the root package. Moving these wrappers to a new package seems overkill. Another name could be "client wrapper" or something like that, but "service" sounds better.

Closes https://github.com/manuelmauro/algonaut/issues/99

title: Remove MicroAlgos/Algos conversions
body: Closes https://github.com/manuelmauro/algonaut/issues/135

title: Fix deserialization bugs
body: Closes https://github.com/manuelmauro/algonaut/issues/138

title: Change input of sign_transaction to be an actual Transaction.
body: Closes #137

title: Replace vector with mut slice in assign_group_id
body: Closes https://github.com/manuelmauro/algonaut/issues/136

title: Add series of functions for "simpler" error checking.
body:
For #126.

Added a few more methods (that are private) which may or may not be helpful in the future.

title: Update documentation
body: Updated to match the README. We edited / removed this.

title: Pass params as reference
body: This is better since params are often reused (e.g. when building transaction groups).

title: Set transaction fee correctly
body:
Basically ported this: https://github.com/algorand/go-algorand-sdk/blob/c37407700af350ef13aea10b844529144f498b6c/future/transaction.go#L14-L29

Notes:

- The semantics around the fee "estimation" are a bit weird, it's more an accurate prediction of the signed txn size, if it has a regular signature (not lsig or msig). But I didn't want to diverge much from the official SDK for now. 
- Renamed the `fee` field in the [txn params](https://developer.algorand.org/docs/rest-apis/algod/v2/#get-v2transactionsparams) into `fee_per_byte`, to make clearer what it is.
- Added an enum `TxnFee` to the txn builder, to be able to set the fee to either "estimated" (based on `fee_per_byte` / `min_fee` and the "estimated" txn size) or fixed, which is just setting directly the txn's fee.
- The `TxnBuilder` `with` initializer implementation was adjusted to use `TxnFee::Estimated`, which seems a sensible default.
- Added a new convenience initializer to `TxnBuilder` called `with_fee`, which allows to pass the params and set the fee. Having to pass `first_valid`, `genesis_hash` etc. in order to set the fee is inconvenient. The current naming `with` / `with_fee` / `new` feels a bit arbitrary but prioritizing shortness - can be discussed.
- Added a `zero()` convenience initializer to the `TxnFee` enum, to be able to create easily a `0` fee. This is useful for txn groups, where `lsig` txn fees are paid by another txn in the group. Here the `lsig` txn's fee is set to `0`. Note that this used to be solved by sending a dedicated "pay fee" txn.
- Added `estimate_fee` and `estimate_fee_with_params`(convenience) to `Transaction`, to be able to easily calculate the fee - this is useful again for txn groups, when calculating the fee for the "paying" txn.
- Not using a hardcoded [MinTxnFee](https://github.com/algorand/go-algorand-sdk/blob/c37407700af350ef13aea10b844529144f498b6c/transaction/transaction.go#L13). This is provided by the API (transaction params) and it's a required field in our case (we have a higher min consensus version).

title: Fix 0 amount asset transfer deserialized to asset opt-in
body: Added check for tx sender == asset receiver to identify the tx as opt-in

title: Replace Option<Vec> with <Vec> + default deserialization
body:
`Option<Vec>` is not meaningful here and it makes accessing the field inconvenient. 

When the API doesn't send the value (which means empty vector anyway, due to the API's zero values policy), it will be converted into an empty vector.

Also fixes the deserialization of `ApplicationLocalState.key_value`, which is was incorrectly non-optional.

Added `skip_serializing_if` too, though it's not strictly needed, see https://github.com/manuelmauro/algonaut/pull/130

title: refactor(examples): update imports to use "algonaut::" namespace
body: This lets the example code imports work when copied and pasted to external projects that depend only on the "algonaut" crate, rather than the individual crates.

title: Generate program hash clientside and CompiledTeal refactoring
body: The compiled TEAL hash is now generated by the SDK. We can't assume the hash to always be pre-generated, e.g. when loading the compiled programs from a database (where it would be wasteful to store the hash). Supporting both the pre-generated hash and the on-demand hash seemed overkill (we have `ContractAccount` to cache the address, which is likely the most frequent use of this hash) so for now it's always generated by the SDK. This change also allowed a refactoring which simplified the functionality around `CompiledTeal` significantly.

title: Fix parsing of some Indexer responses
Refactor algod/kmd/indexer initializers
body:
Removed the builder pattern and moved the initialization to the respective services.

This might look less fancy, but more things are checked at compile time, and it's shorter and easier to understand. There was no discernible benefit in using the builder pattern, having the initializers in a separate module (with the implementation "as is"), or bundling the initialization of different versions under the same namespace. Maybe I'm missing something.

The "custom endpoint" builders are now a regular initializer too (https://github.com/manuelmauro/algonaut/issues/109#issuecomment-980532484).

If in the future we use traits (e.g. for the services, or the client), it could make sense to move the initialization to separate modules, but this seems unlikely (soon at least), and shouldn't be much effort to change if/when it happens.

Up to discussion (just a proposal).

@AlterionX feel free to review/comment as well.

title: Configure Algorand SDKs tests + implement applications feature
Fixes for Indexer AccountTransactions deserialisation
body:
1. use `deserialize-hash` for genesis transaction - same as `Block`
2. make signature field optional


When using `Indexer::account_transactions`

Without fix 1. `Error: http error: None, Client error: error decoding response body: Invalid byte array length: 44 at line 1 column 234`
Without fix 2. `Error: http error: None, Client error: error decoding response body: missing field 'signature' at line 1 column 6690`

title: removed algod1 api
body: closes #110

title: Derive Serialize, Deserialize for SuggestedTransactionParams
body: Useful, for example when you want to treat SuggestedTransactionParams like a JSON object.

title: Add ability to include additional custom headers.
body:
It's useful for interfacing with third party services (e.g. [PureStake](purestake.io)) if they don't require a completely different API and instead just an API key.

There were a few methods earlier related to custom headers, whose values were largely ignored. Not entirely sure why this was the case, but went ahead and wired the pieces together.

The API is a little inconsistent (`headers` vs `header`) but wasn't sure if there was a reason for going with one or the other or if I should have implemented both.

title: Add feature flags for selecting rustls or openssl as the tls implementation.
body:
A simple switch for allowing `reqwest` to compile with `rustls` instead of `native` which relies on `openssl`.

`openssl` is known to be a non-trivial dependency in the compilation process.
